intro: Ziegera laevigata, commonly known as the smoothleaf ziegera, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of pink and purple, often arranged in terminal clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Ziegera laevigata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
